title: Classified Thread 2: Best In Classified
summary:
Key ideas
- The rationalist community in SF Bay Area has gathered a small intellectual/social scene.
- Due to high rent prices, many rationalists live in group houses which have become nuclei for social events and cooperation.
- There are four adjacent houses available for rent and the rationalists want to turn the area into a center of the community.
 
Key learnings
- Rationalists believe in philosophy, effective altruism, and transhumanism.
- The Bay Area has terrible rent prices and absurd local politics.
- The rationalist community can be life-changing for some, but difficult to get into for others. 

Key questions
- How can rationalists accelerate and develop the community further?
- What is the criteria for people who are interested in renting individual rooms or entire houses?
- How will renting these houses impact the existing rationalist community in the area?
